senses.de: Related to cooking or the kitchen.
senses.ex: She attended a culinary school to become a professional chef.

Tips.title: Professional Context
Tips.description: Culinary is often used to describe professional cooking and related activities.
Tips.example: He writes for culinary magazines, sharing his expertise.

Tips.title: Not Just Food
Tips.description: 'Culinary' refers to all things related to the kitchen, not just food itself.
Tips.example: Culinary equipment is essential for a well-functioning restaurant.

Tips.title: Specialized Study
Tips.description: Culinary arts is a field of study that deals with cooking and kitchen management.
Tips.example: She is pursuing a degree in culinary arts.

Cook.wordDefinition:
Cook refers to a person who prepares food by following recipes or instructions to make meals. It is commonly used in everyday conversation and refers to a basic skill of making food.

Culinary refers to the art and science of preparing and cooking food. It encompasses the broader knowledge, skills, and techniques related to cooking, including food presentation, food pairing, and knowledge of ingredients.

It is used in a professional setting, such as culinary schools or in the hospitality industry, to describe the higher level of knowledge and skill required to excel in cooking as a profession.

Cookery.wordDefinition:
Cookery refers to the practice or skill of preparing food for eating, while culinary refers to the art or science of cooking and the preparation and cooking of food in general.

Cookery refers more specifically to the act of cooking, while culinary refers to the entire field of food preparation and cooking, including the science behind it.

Cookery is more commonly used in everyday speech, whereas culinary is more frequently used in professional settings or when referring to high-quality or gourmet food.

Cuisine.wordDefinition:
Both cuisine and culinary refer to food and cooking, but cuisine usually refers to the specific style of cooking and eating associated with a particular culture or region, while culinary refers to the overall art and science of cooking.

For example, French cuisine refers to the specific cooking techniques, ingredients, and dishes associated with France, while culinary arts refers to the broader field of food preparation, including techniques, equipment, and presentation.

Cuisine is often used to describe a particular type of restaurant or menu, such as Italian cuisine or Asian cuisine. Culinary is more often used to describe the skills and knowledge required for cooking, such as culinary school or a career in the culinary arts.

Epicurean.wordDefinition:
Culinary refers to anything related to cooking, preparing, or serving food, whereas epicurean refers to someone who enjoys fine food and wine, and the pursuit of pleasure through food.

Epicurean, on the other hand, describes a person who is knowledgeable about and enjoys fine food and drink. If you go to a fancy restaurant with a menu of gourmet dishes, you might say that it caters to the epicurean palate.

Culinary refers to the field of food preparation, while epicurean refers to someone who takes pleasure in eating and drinking good quality food and wine.

Foodie.wordDefinition:
Foodie refers to a person who has a strong interest in and appreciation for food, often seeking out unique and high-quality dining experiences.

Culinary refers to the act of cooking and preparing food, while foodie refers to a person who enjoys and appreciates food.

Gastronomic.wordDefinition:
Both culinary and gastronomic are used to refer to food, cooking, and eating experiences.

However, culinary has a more basic meaning and refers to the act of cooking or preparing food, while gastronomic has to do with the art of cooking, with an emphasis on how flavors and textures work together.

For example, a chef might describe themselves as having "culinary skills," while a food critic might use the word gastronomic to describe a particularly memorable meal.

Culinary is used in more everyday contexts, while gastronomic is more often associated with fine dining and gourmet experiences.

Gourmet.wordDefinition:
Gourmet refers to a person who has refined tastes in food, or to the high quality, often expensive, food that a gourmet enjoys.

For example, a gourmet restaurant may serve very fancy, expensive dishes.

Culinary describes anything related to cooking and food, while gourmet describes a person's refined taste in food, or the quality of the food itself.

Kitchen.wordDefinition:
Kitchen refers to the physical space where food is prepared and cooked. It is a noun used to describe a room equipped for cooking, typically including appliances such as a stove, oven, and refrigerator.

Culinary is a term used to describe the art of cooking, while kitchen is a term used to describe the physical space where cooking takes place.

videos.Text: In the densely populated city-states of Mesopotamia, cheese became a staple of culinary and religious life. Some of the earliest known writing includes administrative records of cheese quotas, listing a variety of cheeses for different rituals and populations across Mesopotamia.

quotes.Text: When you have a chef that wants to be in the spotlight, maybe after one or two appearances on a show, they think they're at a certain level that they haven't reached yet in the kitchen. Shows like 'Top Chef', 'Hell's Kitchen' have helped bring attention to the culinary world.
quotes.Title: American Chef
quotes.Name: Geoffrey Zakarian

quotes.Text: I needed a break, and going to culinary school turned a lightbulb on that I didn't have to make music. The people in the music business forget that not only is there an entire world of people out there who do not care what we do, we are not creating the wheel.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Kelis

quotes.Text: I started culinary school at a very young age, and really I wanted to be out working, cooking, more than I wanted to be in a classroom. You could say I wasn't a very good student - I wanted to be a student of life and experience.
quotes.Title: Spanish Chef
quotes.Name: Jose Andres

quotes.Text: My journey was never hard; it just happened. From the second I held a knife, from the second I was in culinary school, it's all felt too good to be true. 'This cannot be my job, my life. Somebody has to be kidding with me!
quotes.Title: American Chef
quotes.Name: Damaris Phillips

quotes.Text: My tortured life - with its extremes and conflicts - might have been difficult for me to deal with, but the press couldn't get enough of it. I was in the papers every day, 'the enfant terrible of the culinary world.
quotes.Title: British Chef
quotes.Name: Marco Pierre White

quotes.Text: The culinary tradition in my family is very strong. My mother, a very wise woman, spent the better part of her life in a kitchen. It's a very strong part of her identity. I grew up there next to the fire.
quotes.Title: Mexican Author
quotes.Name: Laura Esquivel

quotes.Text: It's very important to me that people who are actual chefs and other professionals in the culinary world, understand that I'm not, and have never held myself out as being, like a CIA trained chef.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Ted Allen

quotes.Text: At culinary school, none of the things we use to define ourselves outside that world - actor, producer, student - none of that matters. It's a magical art form.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Eric Christian Olsen

quotes.Text: We have breathtaking state and national parks, flourishing adventure tourism and culinary scenes and the world's best horses. And of course bourbon.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Andy Beshear

quotes.Text: For me, 'Jewishness' manifests within my humor, slang, cynicism, culinary tastes, and the spirit of generosity ingrained in me.
quotes.Title: Australian Athlete
quotes.Name: Zoe Buckman
